warrior_22193: Your paws... they reek of blood.
unabashed elder1: Have you noticed how annoyingly 'cool' the young cats have to be today?
Like, r_a_cool is always out to impress everyone and act like {PRONOUN/r_a_cool/subject}{VERB/r_a_cool/'re/'s} better than others.
What happened to being unique? Showing yourself instead of hiding beneath a facade?
Honestly, r_a_cool looked dumb showing off that kick. Would never be suited for battle.
No, I think r_a_cool's just darling when {PRONOUN/r_a/subject}{VERB/t_c/'re/'s} not busy being 'cool'.
elder_1: Your eyes hold the weight of a life taken.
elder_10: The cats of StarClan. I can see them. They shudder in the wake of your transgression.
elder32132: Ugh. A kit. Get out, you little vermin. I'm trying to get some rest here. Tsk. Never any peace or quiet with kits around...
I don't see why anyone would want any. No, I don't care if you're bored. Shoo! Go back to the nursery.
assertive_elder: Do I ever wish I could explore the territory with the rest of my Clanmates?
Well, sure ... but there's plenty of adventure to be found here in the elder's den, as well!
Who else can drop everything to help our Clanmates who are in need of comfort? Or play with the kits when their parents need a break? Or keep you entertained when you want a story? Hehehe.
I may be an elder, but don't be fooled. I contribute to the Clan in my own special way.
assertive_elder2: Get me a piece of prey from the freshkill pile, wouldja, y_c? I'm practically starving to death over here.
Kits and elders eat first, after all. Hehehe! I could get used to this life!
assertive_elder3: y_c! Get over here and do some exercises with me, won't ya? If the medicine cat wants me to stay cooped up in this den all day, they'll have to drag me back in themselves!
[You and t_c chat about your days as you walk laps around camp, side-by-side, pelts brushing in the morning sun.]
assertive_elder3_2: Hey, y_c! How was your day?
The craziest thing happened to me today ... I was telling a story to r_k, and then, later in the day, {PRONOUN/r_k/subject} {VERB/r_k/were/was} repeating the story to all {PRONOUN/r_k/poss} friends!
And then, {PRONOUN/r_k/subject} started acting it out, and playing all the characters together ... StarClan, it was so cool to watch.
It's nice to know that I'm making a difference, y'know?
Anyways, wanna share a meal together later?
assertive_elder4: Any chance you can help me sneak outta here later? I'm going insane trapped inside this place ... plus, all my denmates snore like crazy!
I know there's a way out by the camp entrance ... maybe you can distract the guards, then slip out and meet up with me later?
Ah, don't look so scared! No reason an elder can't get out and stretch {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} legs once in a while, huh? It's good for my health!
cool_elder: There's my beautiful mate. How've you been, gorgeous? Survive another day of work without me?
I'm fine, as always, though every second without you is frankly unbearable.
So, c'mon, then! Come share tongues with me!
We both know you'd never pass up that opportunity.
cool_elder1: The smell of this den ... StarClan, I can hardly stand it!
Like dust mixed with herb poultice mixed with old, decaying leaves. Where's the vibrance? Where's the energy?
Oh, no ... Don't tell me I'm starting to smell like that, too!
introspective_elder: Somehow, even as a kit, I've always felt like the elders' denis where I most belonged.
Dispensing wisdom ... admiring nature ... taking in the day-to-day scenery around camp ... There's something so beautiful in the mundanity of it all, don't you think?
Though, I suppose I always have been labeled an 'old soul' ...
assertive_elder5: Hmph. Come to mock me again?
assertive_elder6: Hey, y_c, come and help me to my paws. I wanna play a prank on plove_r_c.
What? You mean you refuse to help a poor, helpless elder find a little harmless joy in {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} life? Hmph. How heartless!
Guess who just landed {PRONOUN/y_c/self} a spot on my 'next-to-prank' list?
introspective_elder2: Hi, y_c. Want to try out this new training exercise the medicine cat just taught me?
It's called 'practiced breathing.' You just have to close your eyes, relax, and breathe in, two, three, four ... and out, two, three, four.
In, two, three, four ... and out, two, three, four.
... It's supposed to keep my lungs healthy and exercised, but I think it can be useful for a lot of different things. Like, easing anxiety, for instance.
Come and find me if you ever want to learn more stuff!
introspective_elder3: Oh, hello, y_c. No, I'm not talking to myself. I'm counting all of the rocks I see around camp!
It can get pretty boring sometimes in the elder's den. But I refuse to just while away the days, letting my mind turn into mush. I need to exercise it, so I can stay as sharp as ever!
Oh, mouse-dung, now I've lost count.
sweet_elder1: Oh, y_c, it's so good to see you!
You've been so busy lately, are you making sure to take care of yourself? Your health is super important, y'know!
The older cats are teaching me a lot about stuff, they're actually gonna tell me a story they've been hyping up for a while now.
You should stop by later, take a break from the patrols and bring a snack or two? I'd love to tell you about it!
sweet_elder2: y_c! There you are! How was your day, sweetheart?
I always get so worried seeing you head out there, I hope you're taking care of yourself.
I know I know, I shouldn't worry so much, but I do! I can't let the most amazing cat in the world get hurt, y'know?
Well, enjoy your day, my love! I'll stop by your den and make sure your nest is nice and tidy, just for you.
young_eldergen: All these pitying looks ... I just can't stand it!
Like, yeah, I may be an elder, but my brain still works just fine! Unlike half the cats in this Clan ...
What's it gonna take to be treated with some respect around here? It's not like I'm some sad, helpless kit! I'm a c_nClan cat, just like everybody else!
young_eldergen1: I'm so sick and tired of cats asking me why I chose to retire rather than doing something 'useful'.
First of all, I'm plenty useful! I do chores around camp, I kitsit, I help care for my denmates, I make others laugh ...

And second, why do I even have to be so-called 'useful' anyways? Doesn't just ... existing as a living, breathing cat give my life value? Why should I have to prove my 'use' to be worthy of respect and a place in the Clan?
*Sigh* Whatever. Thanks for listening to me rant, y_c.
It isn't easy being a young elder. But still, at the end of the day, this is who I am. And I wouldn't have it any other way.
young_eldergen1_2: Hey, y_c! My denmates are the best storytellers... they just told me this really cool one, how did it go again?
It was like... There once was an apprentice called Doepaw. She had a brother, Stagpaw, and her mother was training in the Dark Forest .... er, actually, maybe I wasn't supposed to tell you that yet.
*Sigh* Oh, well. Looks like I'll need to practice my storytelling skills!
If you ever stop by again, I'll try to have a better one ready!
silly_elder: How'd I end up retired? Oh well, it's a funny story...

When I was just a kit, I was kidnapped by a hawk! Luckily, it dropped me ... right into the jaws of a huge dog! The dog then abandoned me to be discovered by foxes, but then this huge flood came and washed us all away into enemy territory, and ...
silly_elder_2: How'd I end up retired? Oh well, it's a funny story ...

When I was just a kit, I was kidnapped by a hawk! Luckily, the hawk dropped me ... right into the jaws of a huge dog! The dog then abandoned me to be discovered by foxes, but then this huge flood came and washed us all away, and ...
upstanding_elder: What do you need, y_c? I'm very busy. I have a full schedule today!
*Sigh* Yes, even though I'm an elder.

Since my retirement, I've really stepped into managing the affairs of my older denmates. It's a full-time job, keeping track of their health needs, assisting them through physical exercises, helping their memories ...
Now, if you'll excuse me, one of my denmates has a meeting with their grandkits imminently. Goodbye!
sweet_elder3: Yes, very good! And what's the name of that apprentice, over there ...?
Oh, hello, y_c! I didn't see you there. I was just helping one of my denmates through a memory exercise!

I think {PRONOUN/r_e/poss} mind is slipping a bit ... {PRONOUN/r_e/subject} almost couldn't recognize me this morning! Perfectly natural at {PRONOUN/r_e/poss} age, of course, but I'd like to help {PRONOUN/r_e/object} hold onto {PRONOUN/r_e/poss} wits as long as possible.
So right now, I'm challenging {PRONOUN/r_e/object} to name all the cats around camp.
[t_c's face lights up as the elder correctly identifies you as y_c.]
sweet_elder4: *Sigh* It can be so difficult, getting them to eat sometimes ...
y_c, could you run to the medicine den and see if they have anything to help the elders with their appetites?
I'm really starting to get worried ...
brooding_elder111: How'd I end up in the elder's den?
Hmph. Why does everyone always ask me that?
At least come up with an original question.
neurotic_elder: How'd I end up in the elder's den?
introspective_elder1: How'd I end up in the elder's den?

[t_c calmly and evenly explains to you the circumstances around {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} disability, {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} decision to retire, and {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} perspectives on the social systems within the Clan.]
[It amazes you just how insightful {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/are/is}, and you leave the den with heightened respect for {PRONOUN/t_c/object}!]
silly_elder_15: How did I end up in the elders' den?
What, do ya want a live reenactment?
assertivewarrior_leader2: Oh, what I'd give for nine lives!
I already try to throw myself into whatever challenge I'm given, but you're on a whole other level! With nine lives, you could be really ... truly ... FEARLESS!
assertive_queen: Heya, y_c! How are the little ones today?
If you ever need any help at all, just give me a shout. I know they can be a pawful! Heh.
assertive_queensapp2: Hey, y_c! How are the kits today?
Ahhhh! StarClan, they're so cute! Can I help groom them?

Or - how about this? Maybe, every once in a while, I can hold a little kit-training session! Help them get a head start on their apprenticeships! It'll be like having a den of little warriors, hehehe!
Though, I guess I can see how that wouldn't be the best for you ...
Oh, what the heck. Let the kits be kits for now! They'll start their training when they're ready.
Seeya, y_c! I'll definitely have to come and visit more often.
assertive_queensapp1: Hehe. Of course you'd never leave the nursery, y_c.
You don't have what it takes to be a real warrior. Not in a million moons!
But, uh, this is ... okay too, I guess! If you think becoming a full-time kitsitter is comparable to, y'know ... finding food and protecting the Clan from danger.
Have fun hanging out with the queens, y_c. *Snrk*
assertivewarrior_mediatorapp: Man, you're insightful for an apprentice, y_c!
When I was your age, all I thought about was smashing stuff and chasing after my crushes. But now, here you are! Sorting out problems with cats who've been around ten times longer than you!
That must take a lot of discipline. The whole Clan is proud of you!
assertive_medapp: How's it going, mini-medicine cat? Herbal life treating you well?
Don't worry, I'm not going to run headfirst into trouble and injure myself today.
assertive_warrior_or_elder: Working hard, y_c? Or, is it more like hardly working? Hehe.
Y'know, it's good to contribute to the Clan, but make sure you take some time to grow up, too. Working isn't everything. Now's the time for you to get out and explore!
*Sigh* I sorta miss those days myself ...
assertive_elder_3: Hey there, y_c! Stop by for a story? StarClan knows I got plenty to go around!
There was this one time in my apprenticeship when I was cornered by a whole pack of dogs! They were huge ones, too. I just barely escaped by the tip of my tail!
Ah, I can't deny I miss those days ... but I'm making plenty of memories right here in camp, too.
assertive_elder_4: *Cough* *Cough* ... Oh, hey, young'un! What brings you by the elders' den?
Just want to chat? Hehe, can't say I mind! It's so boring in here nowadays ...
Say, how's about we take this conversation outside? I'm dyin' to stretch my legs, they feel like they're about to snap off!
See if you can keep up, hehehe!
assertive_elder_5: I saw d_n show off a belly rake to some apprentices earlier. Took me back to my glory days!
I wonder if I could still ...

[With a grunt and a whole load of popping joints, t_c rears and performs a creaky, but still stunningly precise belly rake. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/plop/plops} back into {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} nest, panting with exertion.]
assertive_elder_6: Look at us, huh? Old bags of fur.
Hard to believe our golden years are over ...
Though, on the other paw, who says they have to be? I'm just getting started!
assertive_elder_7: Ah, no need to look so grumpy, you old bag of bones, we got plenty to smile about!
We got a roof over our heads, plenty to eat ... StarClan knows that wasn't true all our lives.
So, just try to relax and enjoy it! I know I will.
assertive_elder_8: Hey, y_c, come walk some laps with me!
Psh, badger droppings! I'll rest plenty when I'm dead!
assertive_elder_9: So, you've stopped by the elders' den for a bit of wisdom, ah?
My philosophy is this: always work hard, fight hard, and play hard, too!
Do everything with courage. After all, you'll never catch anything if you never pounce!
And don't be afraid to make mouse-brained mistakes. StarClan knows I have, and I've lived this long!
Do this, and you'll have success, no matter what you're going after. Life's too short to live with regrets!
assertive_elder_10: Hey, kit, come change my moss, will ya? I'm chafing something unreal.
After that, head to the medicine den and get some mouse bile. I'm lousy with ticks!
assertive_elder_11: Tell ya what, kid, you're much smarter than I ever was at your age.
Maybe you'll go far ... If you see me in StarClan at your leader's ceremony, don't be surprised! Hehe!
assertive_elder_12: Hey, y_c, you got anything to make my joints less stiff?
I'm not as spry as I used to be, heh ... But I'm not planning on slowing down any time soon!
assertive_elder_13: Don't let anybody tell ya that we elders can't defend ourselves. In my prime, I could take down a whole o_cClan patrol ... With my leg broken!
I'm serious! Ask anybody, they'll tell you!
assertive_elder_133: Tell ya what, there's one secret to me living this long: plain, dumb luck.
With all the stupid stunts I've pulled throughout my life, there's gotta be someone up in StarClan lookin' out for me if I've made it this far!
introspective_elder_2: Good morning, y_c. It's a bright day out there, why are you still here in camp?
You've got so much to do, there's so much stuff to do with your youth, young one. You're wasting it sitting in here doing nothing.
I know facing the world is difficult on some days. You want to hide away, so you don't have to face the storm. But that won't help you.
Your inaction will become your worst action, my friend. Take your life as StarClan's blessing and catch it wholeheartedly in your claws and fangs before it flies away.
That's something I'd wished someone had told me when I was young. Take advantage of having cats in your corner, but spread your wings too.
introspective_elder_1: y_c. It's nice to see you, what seems to be the problem?
I'm fine, my joints are feeling better today, but I'm sure you're here for a reason. Most cats don't come here unless they need something.
Huh? A story? I know a lot of them, but why do you want to hear one?
... I see. I see. You're directionless. I understand that. I suppose it's something everyone goes through at some point.
But I don't think hearing myths about our ancestors will help you, y_c. They're fictional, choices made by cats long ago, embellished by word-of-mouth.
Why not stop praying to kitten stories, and become your own legend instead?
You're never going to become the true version of yourself, if you keep following the pawsteps of those before you.
introspective_elder_2_2: y_c. Good afternoon. Were you looking for me?
Yes, I'm okay. Just watching the cats in the camp-
[t_c gently chuckles at your face before flicking your cheek with a paw gently.]
Don't give me that look, what else do I have to do?
I've given my all to the Clan, but I'm not in StarClan yet. I've still got to give myself some form of entertainment.
Hehe... That's okay. If you ever change your mind, just let me know. I'm not going anywhere.
introspective_elder_3: [t_c is batting at a leaf that had landed on {PRONOUN/t_c/object}.]
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/spring/springs} onto the leaf in a brilliant hunter's catch form, and bat the leaf up into the air to continue to catch it.]
Oh, morning, y_c! Sorry, I was getting my bones working! There's not a whole lot to do around here. Want to join me?
[You spend some time batting the leaf around with t_c.]
introspective_elder_4: Hm...? Oh good afternoon, y_c. You enjoying the day too?
Yeah, I'm just sitting outside, enjoying the breeze. Sometimes you've got to embrace normalcy.
Sometimes things can change so suddenly. Did I tell you about the tale of when the moon swallowed the sun? It happened a very long time ago, in Clans lost to the sands of time.
A loner came to the Clans foretelling of a prophecy, that the sky would turn dark at sunhigh and the moon swallowed the sun. He caused no end of chaos within his time.
Did it happen? I'm not sure, but some say that the tallest tales hold the smallest sparkle of truth.
But anyways, what was I saying... Oh yes. Don't be afraid of normalcy, who knows when it'll leave you?
introspective_elder_5: [t_c is humming to {PRONOUN/t_c/self}, quietly. It... sounds like a nursery tune?]
...teardrops fall onto the nose of the villain, rain to the hero...
[You can't think of the last time that {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/were/was} in the nursery. You wonder how long {PRONOUN/t_c/subject}{VERB/t_c/'ve/'s} known it for.]
assertive_misc: Yaknow, y_c, I never really found you all that convincing as a warrior.
Real warriors are strong! We're fearless! We never back down from a fight!
But in you, I sense ... uncertainty.
Maybe you should see the medicine cat about it.
cool_1: [You find t_c stacking pebbles near the elder's den.]
Oh hey, y_c. I'm trying to recreate a Twoleg den. Pretty neat, huh?
[{PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/place/places} one last rock on top of the pile.]
cool_2: Just an average day in c_nClan!
But that doesn't mean we should take it for granted.
Let's make it a good day.
brooding_elder: [You normally like visiting with the older cats in the Clan, but t_c has always scared you a little.]
[With {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} torn, scarred pelt and {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} mean face, {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/look/looks} just like a monster ripped straight out of one of r_q's stories!]
brooding_elder1: Augh ... Who let the little nuisance into the elder's den again?
With all the moons I've lived, why should I give a mouse's tail what a runty little kit has to say?
brooding_elder2: What is it, y_c? You want a story?
Uhm ... You might have a little more luck going elsewhere.
I don't have many stories. And the ones I do aren't appropriate for kits.
brooding_elder3: [You ask t_c if {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/have/has} any cool stories from {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} youth {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can tell you.]
Uhm ... Well, I guess one time, when I was a young warrior, I ripped a o_cClan cat's throat out with my teeth.
It happened so easily ... It was just like tearing into a piece of prey ... The taste didn't leave my mouth for moons afterwards, and -- Ope.
[r_q quickly swoops in and hurries you away. Safe to say you won't be going to t_c for any stories anymore.]
brooding_elder4: Everyone's in such a hurry. Just try and hold onto your innocence as long as you can ... I can guarantee, you'll miss it when it's gone.
brooding_elder6: Hmph. My advice to you, y_c: don't ever get old.
I used to be one of the most valuable warriors in c_nClan. Now, everyone just talks about me like I'm obsolete. A nobody.
My entire life was my purpose to my Clan ... what do I do now that that purpose is over?
brooding_elder7: If a battle ever made its way into c_nClan camp, don't count on me just lazing around the elder's den.
I still have more than enough fight left in me to defend my Clan, and I'll do it to my last dying breath.
brooding_elder8: [t_c stares at the side of the elder's den resentfully.]
It's not right, me living this long ...
All of my loved ones died honorable deaths, warriors' deaths. What was StarClan thinking? Why am I still here, after all these moons?
Ah ... I'm sorry, y_c. This isn't your battle to fight. It's mine.
I know StarClan has a plan for me. Still, I just can't stop myself from doubting ...
It's easy to lose control of your thoughts when you've been around for so long.
brooding_elder9: ... What are you ogling at? Buzz off! Nothing to see here!
It's just a little cough ... Everybody's looking at me like I'm about to drop dead!
brooding_elder10: My advice? Try not to let yourself get too attached to anyone.
There's nothing more dangerous. Makes it way too easy to lose your grip.
brooding_elder11: All these young cats milling about ... Politics, drama ... It's all just play to me now.
When you've been around as long as I have, you start to realize just how little stuff like that matters.
stable_Elder_Gen_01: [All you did was walk past and t_c just begins rambling again. You sigh and sit down, listening to {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} story. As {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/talk/talks} more and more, you find yourself captivated.]
And that's why you never catch a ladybug under the Thunderpath.
[Despite that story being... confusing, you find it interesting how {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} can recall so much. You thank {PRONOUN/t_c/object} and spend the rest of your day pondering the tale.]

[A story of a bug beneath the Thunderpath that, when caught, brings thunder crashing down... You doubt there's a moral, or even if those were the actual events to have happened. But it's entertaining nonetheless.]
df_elder: Get out of the way before I step on you, kit.
assertive_elder_retag5: Hey, furbag. I brought you something!
[t_c lays a colorful feather at your paws.
I know this is your favorite color, and you miss exploring the territory. So I knew I just had to bring it to you.
Yeah, yeah, don't get all soft on me, hehe. Wanna grab a meal together?
assertive_elder_move6: *Sigh* Can't you see I have more important things to do, y_c?
Go back to catching mice, or whatever.
